MSRCSecurityUpdateSummary: This post provides an update on the vulnerability in Chromium that affects Microsoft Edge and other products. The vulnerability is due to a heap buffer overflow in WebP. The latest version of Microsoft Edge is no longer vulnerable to this issue.

This security update addresses a Denial of Service vulnerability in Microsoft Common Data Model SDK. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability, resulting in the attacker being able to fully deny access to resources in the impacted component.

Information published about a vulnerability in Microsoft's Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) that allows for remote code execution. The vulnerability has a high attack complexity and requires high privileges for successful exploitation. The impact of a successful attack is high, affecting confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the system.
